oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Postcard, soldier and girl sitting on log with poem
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A postcard with "Greetings" at top, depicting a soldier and girl in pink dress sitting on a log. His rifle is propped nearby, and tents in the background. A four-line poem is to the right"What care you for war, Or for war's alarms, So long as you have, Such acomrade in arms?" It is stamped on reverse with advertisement from Smith's Variety Store, Wayside, West Virginia and was collected by Ethel Flesher Stewart of Parkersburg, W. Va.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
